congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 221, waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules, by a recorded vote of 227 ayes to 189 noes, Roll No. 189, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 185 nays, Roll No. 188.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 221, waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules, by a recorded vote of 227 ayes to 189 noes, Roll No. 189, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 185 nays, Roll No. 188.

congVote.result: The joint resolution (S.J. Res. 34) was passed, as follows:
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Protecting the Privacy of Customers of Broadband and Other Telecommunications Services Rule
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>: By 50 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 94), Senate passed S.J. Res. 34, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Federal Communications Commission relating to ``Protecting the Privacy of Customers of Broadband and Other Telecommunications Services''.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate confirmed the following nomination:<P/>By 52 yeas to 46 nays (Vote No. EX. 96), David Friedman, of New York, to be Ambassador to Israel.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 52 yeas to 46 nays (Vote No. 95), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
